ingredients.content: 1 orange, thin peel only, no pith, plus juice (approx. 2.5 oz)
1 lemon, thin peel only, no pith, plus juice (approx. 2.5 oz)
½ tsp ground black pepper, to taste
4 cod fillets, (4-7 oz each, max of 28 oz)
3 oz unsalted butter, plus extra to grease
3 sprigs fresh parsley, leaves only, chopped

preparations.content: Place orange peel, lemon peel, anise seeds, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and zest <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and zest a further <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.
Place water into mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and weigh in potatoes.

Lightly grease Varoma tray. Season both sides of cod fillets with ¼ of the reserved chopped zest. Place fish onto Varoma tray, set Varoma dish  into position and insert Varoma tray, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>15 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Remove Varoma tray. Weigh zucchini into Varoma dish. Insert Varoma tray, turn fish over, secure Varoma lid and steam a further <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Remove Varoma. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Transfer steamed zucchini, fish and potatoes onto a large dish, set aside and keep warm. Empty mixing bowl.
Place butter and remaining citrus zest into mixing bowl and heat <b>4 min/140°F/speed 1<b>.
Add orange and lemon juice into mixing bowl and mix <b>30 sec/speed 3<b>. Place cod, zucchini and potatoes onto plates. Pour warm citrus butter over meal, sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.
